org.fujion.common

Class DateUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.common.DateUtil

  • public class DateUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods for managing dates.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  DateUtil.Format
      Enum representing common date formats.
      static class  DateUtil.TimeUnit
      Represents time units in order of increasing precision.

    • Field Detail

      • TIME_UNIT

        public static String[][] TIME_UNIT
        Labels for time units. TODO: externalize these for localization support.

    • Method Detail

      • parseDate

        public static Date parseDate(String s)

        Convert a string value to a date/time. Attempts to convert using the four locale-specific date formats (FULL, LONG, MEDIUM, SHORT). If these fail, looks to see if T+/-offset or N+/-offset is used.

        TODO: probably we can make the "Java parse" portion a bit smarter by using a better variety of formats, maybe to catch Euro-style input as well.

        TODO: probably we can add something like "t+d" or "t-y" as valid cases; in these scenarios, the coefficient was omitted and could be defaulted to 1.

        Parameters:
        s - String containing value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Date object corresponding to the input value, or null if the parsing failed to resolve a valid Date.

      • parseDate

        public static Date parseDate(String value,
                             String... patterns)
                      throws ParseException
        Attempts to parse an input value using one of several patterns.
        Parameters:
        value - String to parse.
        patterns - Patterns to be tried in succession until parsing succeeds.
        Returns:
        The resulting date value.
        Throws:
        ParseException - Date parsing exception.

        Clones a date.
        Parameters:
        date - Date to clone.
        Returns:

        public static Date addDays(Date date,
                           int daysOffset,
                           boolean stripTime)
        Adds specified number of days to date and, optionally strips the time component.
        Parameters:
        date - Date value to process.
        daysOffset - # of days to add.
        stripTime - If true, strip the time component.
        Returns:
        Input value the specified operations applied.

        Returns:
        Date without the time component.

      • compare

                          Date date2)
        Compares two dates. Allows nulls.
        Parameters:
        date1 - First date to compare.
        date2 - Second date to compare.
        Returns:
        Result of comparison.

      • formatDate

        public static String formatDate(Date date)
        Converts a date/time value to a string, using the format dd-mmm-yyyy hh:mm. Because we cannot determine the absence of a time from a time of 24:00, we must assume a time of 24:00 means that no time is present and strip that from the return value.
        Parameters:
        date - Date value to convert.
        Returns:
        Formatted string representation of the specified date, or an empty string if date is null.

      • formatDate

        public static String formatDate(Date date,
                                boolean showTimezone)
        Converts a date/time value to a string, using the format dd-mmm-yyyy hh:mm. Because we cannot determine the absence of a time from a time of 24:00, we must assume a time of 24:00 means that no time is present and strip that from the return value.
        Parameters:
        date - Date value to convert.
        showTimezone - If true, time zone information is also appended.
        Returns:
        Formatted string representation of the specified date, or an empty string if date is null.

      • formatDate

        public static String formatDate(Date date,
                                boolean showTimezone,
                                boolean ignoreTime)
        Converts a date/time value to a string, using the format dd-mmm-yyyy hh:mm. Because we cannot determine the absence of a time from a time of 24:00, we must assume a time of 24:00 means that no time is present and strip that from the return value.
        Parameters:
        date - Date value to convert
        showTimezone - If true, time zone information is also appended.
        ignoreTime - If true, the time component is ignored.
        Returns:
        Formatted string representation of the specified date, or an empty string if date is null.

      • formatDate

        public static String formatDate(Date date,
                                String timeSeparator)
        Same as formatDate(Date, boolean) except replaces the time separator with the specified string.
        Parameters:
        date - Date value to convert
        timeSeparator - String to use in place of default time separator
        Returns:
        Formatted string representation of the specified date using the specified time separator.

        The HL7-formatted date.

                                   DateUtil.TimeUnit minUnits)

        minUnits - Minimum units for return value (null = ms).
        Returns:
        Elapsed time in displayable format.

      • formatElapsed

        public static String formatElapsed(double elapsed,
                                   boolean pluralize,
                                   boolean abbreviated,
                                   boolean round)
        Return elapsed time in ms to displayable format with units.
        Parameters:
        elapsed - Elapsed time in ms.
        pluralize - If true, pluralize units when appropriate.
        abbreviated - If true, use abbreviated form of units.
        round - If true, round result to an integer.
        Returns:
        Elapsed time in displayable format.

      • formatElapsed

        public static String formatElapsed(double elapsed,
                                   boolean pluralize,
                                   boolean abbreviated,
                                   boolean round,
                                   DateUtil.TimeUnit minUnits)
        Return elapsed time in ms to displayable format with units.
        Parameters:
        elapsed - Elapsed time in ms.
        pluralize - If true, pluralize units when appropriate.
        abbreviated - If true, use abbreviated form of units.
        round - If true, round result to an integer.
        minUnits - Minimum units for return value (null = ms).
        Returns:
        Elapsed time in displayable format.

                                  DateUtil.TimeUnit units)
        Parses an elapsed time string, returning time in specified units.
        Parameters:
        value - The string value to parse.
        units - The units of the returned value (defaults to ms).
        Returns:
        The elapsed time value in the requested units.

      • formatAge

        public static String formatAge(Date dob)

        Returns age as a formatted string expressed in days, months, or years, depending on whether person is an infant (< 2 mos), toddler (> 2 mos, < 2 yrs), or more than 2 years old.

        Parameters:
        dob - Date of person's birth
        Returns:
        the age display string

      • formatAge

        public static String formatAge(Date dob,
                               boolean pluralize,
                               Date refDate)

        Returns age as a formatted string expressed in days, months, or years, depending on whether person is an infant (< 2 mos), toddler (> 2 mos, < 2 yrs), or more than 2 years old.

        Allows the caller to specify an "as-of" date. The calculated age will be as-of the provided date, rather than as-of the current date.

        Allows the caller to specify whether or not to pluralize the age units in the age display string.

        Parameters:
        dob - Date of person's birth
        pluralize - If true, pluralize the age units in the age display string.
        refDate - The date as of which to calculate the Person's age (null means today).
        Returns:
        the age display string

      • toDate

        public static Date toDate(int day,
                          int month,
                          int year)
        Converts day, month, and year to a date.
        Parameters:
        day - Day of month.
        month - Month (1=January, etc.)
        year - Year (4 digit).
        Returns:
        Date instance.

      • toDate

        public static Date toDate(int day,
                          int month,
                          int year,
                          int hr,
                          int min,
                          int sec)
        Converts day, month, year and time parameters to a date.
        Parameters:
        day - Day of month.
        month - Month (1=January, etc.)
        year - Year (4 digit).
        hr - Hour of day.
        min - Minutes past the hour.
        sec - Seconds past the minute.
        Returns:
        Date instance.
